def histogram(lst, w):
    lst = [n // w for n in lst]
    m = max(lst, default=-1) + 1
    return [lst.count(n) for n in range(m)]

def histogram(v, w):
    return [sum(j in range(i, w+i) for j in v) for i in range(0, max(v)+1, w)] if v else []

def histogram(values, bin_width):
    return [sum([values.count(i + j) for i in range(bin_width)]) for j in range(max(values) + 1) if j % bin_width == 0] if values else []

def histogram(a, n):
    r = [0] * (max(a, default=-1) // n + 1)
    for x in a: r[x // n] += 1
    return r

from collections import Counter

def histogram(values, bin_width):
    count = Counter(values)
    return [sum(count[i+x] for x in range(bin_width)) for i in range(0, max(count) + 1, bin_width)] if count else []

from collections import Counter

def histogram(values, bin_width):
    count = Counter(values)
    return [sum(count[i+x] for x in range(bin_width)) for i in range(0, max(count, default=0)+1, bin_width)] if count else []
